values.comment: A deal-breaker is a requirement that if not met by the certified operation will lead to automatic de-certification with no chance for implementation of correction action plan
A major non-compliance is a requirement that if not met has to be addressed as priority in a corrective actions plan and will be checked in a more restricted timeframe than usual surveillance audit.
values.value: Major non-compliance - definition and corrective actions policy

values.comment: Minor non-compliance refers to requirements that if they are not met need to lead to improvements as part of normal corrective actions plan and surveillance audits
values.value: Minor non-compliance - definition and corrective actions policy
